round_best: Develop a dynamic, adaptive causal discovery framework that utilizes reinforcement learning to iteratively refine its understanding of causal relationships in real-time data streams. The framework would start with base assumptions drawn from a combination of existing causal models and expert domain knowledge, then use feedback from observed outcomes to adjust the causal links and strength of interactions. This approach not only learns and updates the causal model as new data becomes available, but also adapts to changes in the underlying causal structure over time, making it robust to the evolving nature of real-world systems.
